name: 英文散文選讀
restrict: ◎第一階段限 榮譽英語學程 ◎必須先修過【英文（二）】
description: Students will gain an appreciation of prose literature in English, broaden related contextual knowledge, and improve their English comprehension and critical thinking. Students will be introduced to methods of “close-reading” whereby they will understand the elements of English writing style. This will be done through reading famous works of English fiction and non-fiction writing in long and short form along with a basic introduction to the terminology used when discussing fiction and non-fiction works in English. The class will include group discussions on the selected prose where free interpretation and critical opinion is encouraged and practiced.
goals: 強化學生英語文閱讀、聆聽的策略與能力，協助獲取專業領域新知
提昇英語文口語、寫作的表達能力，期盼學生能於工作職場及學術研究領域展現英語專業涵養。
協助學生深入瞭解國際社會的多元文化，培養國際觀，對特定文化現象進行分析、比較，激發學生之批判性思考能力。
syllabus:
Readings in English Prose (Fall 2020)

Syllabus

This course will be taught in English.

Instructor: Chingshun J. Sheu 許景順 ([cjsheu@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:cjsheu@ntnu.edu.tw)).

Class meetings: Mondays 1320-1510.

Assigned text: Card, Orson Scott. _Ender’s Game_. Tor, 1994 \[or later edition; must have author’s introduction\]. Can be bought at Bookman書林.

Objectives: Students will gain an appreciation of prose literature in English, broaden related contextual knowledge, and improve their English comprehension and critical thinking.

Grading:           40% Final exam

                            34% Responses

26% Weekly quizzes

Final exam: Students will have one week to answer the open-book take-home exam. No late submissions. _Plagiarism will result in an exam grade of 0 (zero)._

Responses: Students will write two responses exploring the main ideas of a text. A response should include a summative argument and textual evidence. No late submissions. _Plagiarism will result in a response grade of 0 (zero)._

Weekly quizzes: Students should read the assigned texts _before class_ each week and answer the open-book repeatable weekly quiz online. During class, students will divide into groups to discuss questions from the instructor. They will then share their answers with the class. No makeup quizzes.
